rule.description: Detects high CPU usage by a server application on the basis of 3 consecutive measurements in a 15 minute period
rule.name: High Process CPU: Server
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = HighProcessCPU.hostIpAddr, appName = HighProcessCPU.appName, cpuUtil = HighProcessCPU.AVG(cpuUtil)

rule.description: Detects high memory usage by a server application on the basis of 3 consecutive measurements in a 15 minute period
rule.name: High Process Memory: Server
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = HighProcessMemory.hostIpAddr, appName = HighProcessMemory.appName, memUtil = HighProcessMemory.AVG(memUtil)

rule.description: Detects the process count at a server to be twice the average
rule.name: Server Process Count Anomaly
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ExcessProcessCount.hostIpAddr, procCount = ExcessProcessCount.AVG(procCount)

rule.description: Detects that the health of a network device is critical and needs immediate attention based average CPU, memory and interface utilization and interface errors - at least one of the measured attributes has crossed the specified HIGH threshold
rule.name: Network Device Health: Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = NetHealthCrit.hostIpAddr,hostName = NetHealthCrit.hostName

rule.description: Detects that the health of a windows server is critical and needs immediate attention based average CPU, memory, disk and interface utilization and interface errors - at least one of the measured attributes has crossed the specified HIGH threshold
rule.name: Windows Server Health: Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = WinHealthCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = WinHealthCrit.hostName

rule.description: Detects that the health of a unix server is critical and needs immediate attention based average CPU, memory, disk and interface utilization and interface errors - at least one of the measured attributes has crossed the specified HIGH threshold
rule.name: Unix Server Health: Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = UnixHealthCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = UnixHealthCrit.hostName

rule.description: Detects that the health of a network device need to be watched carefully based average CPU, memory and interface utilization and interface errors- at least one of the measured attributes has crossed the specified LOW threshold but has not yet crossed the specified HIGH threshold
rule.name: Network Device Health: Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = NetHealthWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = NetHealthWarn.hostName

rule.description: Detects that the health of a windows server need to be watched carefully based average CPU, memory, disk and interface utilization and interface errors- at least one of the measured attributes has crossed the specified LOW threshold but has not yet crossed the specified HIGH threshold
rule.name: Windows Server Health: Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = WinHealthWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = WinHealthWarn.hostName

rule.description: Detects that the health of a unix server need to be watched carefully based average CPU, memory, disk and interface utilization and interface errors- at least one of the measured attributes has crossed the specified LOW threshold but has not yet crossed the specified HIGH threshold
rule.name: Unix Server Health: Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = UnixHealthWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = UnixHealthWarn.hostName

rule.description: Detects high CPU usage by an application on the basis of 3 consecutive measurements in a 15 minute period
rule.name: High Process CPU: Network Device
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = NetProcCPUHigh.hostIpAddr, appName = NetProcCPUHigh.appName, cpuUtil = NetProcCPUHigh.AVG(cpuUtil)

rule.description: Detects high memory usage by an application on the basis of 3 consecutive measurements in a 15 minute period
rule.name: High Process Memory: Network Device
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = NetProcMemHigh.hostIpAddr, appName = NetProcMemHigh.appName, memUtil = NetProcMemHigh.AVG(memUtil)

rule.description: Detects that the health of a virtual machine need to be watched carefully based on specific VM metrics such as CPU ready percent, memory swapping rates and disk I/O activity- at least one of the measured attributes has crossed the specified LOW threshold but has not yet crossed the specified HIGH threshold
rule.name: Virtual Machine Health: Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = VMHealthWarn.hostIpAddr,hostName = VMHealthWarn.hostName,phyMachIpAddr = VMHealthWarn.phyMachIpAddr,phyMachName = VMHealthWarn.phyMachName

rule.description: Detects that the health of a virtual machine is critical based on specific VM metrics such as CPU ready percent, memory swapping rates and disk I/O activity- at least one of the measured attributes has crossed the specified HIGH threshold
rule.name: Virtual Machine Health: Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = VMHealthCrit.hostIpAddr,hostName = VMHealthCrit.hostName,phyMachIpAddr = VMHealthCrit.phyMachIpAddr,phyMachName = VMHealthCrit.phyMachName

rule.description: Detects that the health of an ESX server is to be watched carefully since either the performance of one of the component VMs has entered a watched state or the ESX server itself is showing high resource utilization at the aggregate level.
rule.name: ESX Server Health: Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = VMHealthWatch.hostIpAddr, hostName = VMHealthWatch.hostName

rule.description: Detects that the health of an ESX server is critical since either the performance of one of the component VMs is in critical state or the ESX server itself is showing critical resource utilization at the aggregate level.
rule.name: ESX Server Health: Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName = VMHealthWatch.hostName,hostIpAddr = VMHealthWatch.hostIpAddr

rule.description: Detects multiple HTTP client side errors from the same IP - might indicate an attack . Thresholds are 5 errors from the samesrc IP within a 10 minute interval
rule.name: Excessive HTTP Client Side Errors
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessHTTPClientErr.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = ExcessHTTPClientErr.reptDevIpAddr,incidentCount = ExcessHTTPClientErr.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects multiple FTP client side errors from the same IP - might indicate an attack from the source IP
rule.name: Excessive FTP Client Side Errors
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessFTPClientErr.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = ExcessFTPClientErr.reptDevIpAddr,user = ExcessFTPClientErr.user, incidentCount = ExcessFTPClientErr.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects the free space of the file system containing the folder /data/eventdb used for storing events is lower than 20GB. Once the free space is lower than 10GB, the system will automatically purge old events until the free space is more than 20GB. If you do not want this automatical purge of old events, please backup old events to a remote location using nfs, cifs or sftp, otherwise, you can disable this rule.
rule.name: System Warning: Low Storage
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = AOStorageLow.reptDevIpAddr

rule.description: Detects that the system is receiving events at a rate that is higher than the license limit. Events beyond the license limit would be dropped unless the license is upgraded.
rule.name: System License Warning: High Event Rate
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = AOLicenseExpire.reptDevIpAddr

rule.description: Detects that the number of CMDB configuration items is close to the license limit - additonal configuration items would not be stored unless the license is upgraded.
rule.name: System License Warning: High Config Items
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = AOHighCI.reptDevIpAddr

rule.description: Detects that collector is down.
rule.name: System Collector Down
rule.incidentAttrs: customer = AOCollectorDown.customer, phCollectorName = AOCollectorDown.phCollectorName

rule.description: Detects that system collector is down.
rule.name: SP Operation: System Collector Down
rule.incidentAttrs: customer = AOCollectorDown.customer, phCollectorName = AOCollectorDown.phCollectorName

rule.description: Detects that the system discovered more devices than what license allows.
rule.name: System License Warning: Max Number of Devices Exceeded License

rule.description: Detects that system worker is down.
rule.name: System Worker Down
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = AOWorkerDown.hostIpAddr

rule.description: Detects that server CPU has reached a warning level (between 75% and 85% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: Server CPU Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ServCPUWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = ServCPUWarn.hostName, cpuUtil = ServCPUWarn.AVG(cpuUtil)

rule.description: Detects that server CPU has reached a critical level (greater than 85% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: Server CPU Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ServCPUCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = ServCPUCrit.hostName, cpuUtil = ServCPUCrit.AVG(cpuUtil)

rule.description: Detects that a network device CPU has reached a warning level (between 75% and 90% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: Network CPU Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = NetCPUWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = NetCPUWarn.hostName, cpuUtil = NetCPUWarn.AVG(cpuUtil)

rule.description: Detects that a network device CPU has reached a critical level (greater than 90% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: Network CPU Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = NetCPUCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = NetCPUCrit.hostName, cpuUtil = NetCPUCrit.AVG(cpuUtil)

rule.description: Detects that server Memory has reached a warning level (between 75% and 85% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.name: ServMemWarn
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_MEM_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND memName = "Physical Memory"

rule.name: Server Memory Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ServMemWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = ServMemWarn.hostName, memUtil = ServMemWarn.AVG(memUtil)

rule.description: Detects that server memory has reached a critical level (greater than 85% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.name: ServMemCrit
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_MEM_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND memName = "Physical Memory"

rule.name: Server Memory Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ServMemCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = ServMemCrit.hostName, memUtil = ServMemCrit.AVG(memUtil)

rule.description: Detects that server swap memory has reached a critical level (free swap less than minimum swap)
rule.name: Server Swap Memory Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ServSwapMemCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = ServSwapMemCrit.hostName, swapMemUtil = ServSwapMemCrit.AVG(swapMemUtil)

rule.description: Detects that a network device memory usage has reached a warning level (between 50% and 85% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.name: NetMemWarn
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_MEM_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Network) AND memName = "Physical Memory"

rule.name: Network Memory Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = NetMemWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = NetMemWarn.hostName, memUtil = NetMemWarn.AVG(memUtil)

rule.description: Detects that a network device memory has reached a critical level (greater than 85% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.name: NetMemCrit
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_MEM_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Network) AND memName = "Physical Memory"

rule.name: Network Memory Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = NetMemCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = NetMemCrit.hostName, memUtil = NetMemCrit.AVG(memUtil)

rule.description: Detects that server disk space usage has reached a warning level (utilization between 80% and 95% and free disk still greater than 100 MB) based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.groupConstraint: ((AVG(diskUtil) >= 80 AND AVG(diskUtil) <= 95) OR (AVG(diskUtil) >= 95 AND AVG(freeDiskMB) > 100)) AND COUNT(*) >= 2
eventFilters.name: ServDiskWarn
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_DISK_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND diskName NOT IN ("/boot")

rule.name: Server Disk space Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ServDiskWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = ServDiskWarn.hostName, diskName = ServDiskWarn.diskName, diskUtil = ServDiskWarn.AVG(diskUtil)

rule.description: Detects that server disk space usage has reached a critical level (greater than 95% and free disk less than 100 MB) based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.name: ServDiskCrit
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_SYS_DISK_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND diskName NOT IN ("/boot")

rule.name: Server Disk Space Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ServDiskCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = ServDiskCrit.hostName, diskName = ServDiskCrit.diskName, diskUtil = ServDiskCrit.AVG(diskUtil)

rule.description: Detects that server disk I/O latency has reached a warning level (between 20 and 50 msec) based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.groupConstraint: ((AVG(devDiskRdLatency) >= 20 AND AVG(devDiskRdLatency) < 50) OR (AVG(devDiskWrLatency) >= 20 AND AVG(devDiskWrLatency) < 50)) AND COUNT(*) >= 2
eventFilters.name: ServDiskLatencyWarn
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_DISK_IO_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND diskName NOT IN ("/boot")

rule.name: Server Disk Latency Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ServDiskLatencyWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = ServDiskLatencyWarn.hostName, diskName = ServDiskLatencyWarn.diskName, devDiskRdLatency = ServDiskLatencyWarn.AVG(devDiskRdLatency), devDiskWrLatency = ServDiskLatencyWarn.AVG(devDiskWrLatency)

rule.description: Detects that server disk I/O latency has reached a critical level (greater than 50 msec) based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.name: ServDiskLatencyCrit
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_DISK_IO_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND diskName NOT IN ("/boot")

rule.name: Server Disk Latency Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ServDiskLatencyCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = ServDiskLatencyCrit.hostName, diskName = ServDiskLatencyCrit.diskName,devDiskRdLatency = ServDiskLatencyCrit.AVG(devDiskRdLatency), devDiskWrLatency = ServDiskLatencyCrit.AVG(devDiskWrLatency)

rule.description: Detects that interface utilization of a network device has reached a warning level (utilization between 30% and 50% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval. IPS devices are excluded since being a sniffing interface, they have high utilization under normal circumstances.

eventFilters.groupConstraint: ((AVG(inIntfUtil) >= 30 AND AVG(inIntfUtil) <= 50) OR (AVG(outIntfUtil) >= 30 AND AVG(outIntfUtil) <= 50)) AND COUNT(*) >= 2
eventFilters.name: IntfUtilWarn
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_NET_INTF_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Network) AND hostIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS)

rule.name: Network Intf Util Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfUtilWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = IntfUtilWarn.hostName, intfName = IntfUtilWarn.intfName, inIntfUtil = IntfUtilWarn.AVG(inIntfUtil),outIntfUtil = IntfUtilWarn.AVG(outIntfUtil)

rule.description: Detects that interface utilization of a network device has reached a critical level (utilization greater than 50% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval. IPS devices are excluded since being a sniffing interface, they have high utilization under normal circumstances.

eventFilters.name: IntfUtilCrit
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_NET_INTF_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Network) AND hostIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS) AND intfName NOT IN ("lo","Null0")

rule.name: Network Intf Util Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfUtilCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = IntfUtilCrit.hostName, intfName = IntfUtilCrit.intfName, inIntfUtil = IntfUtilCrit.AVG(inIntfUtil),outIntfUtil = IntfUtilCrit.AVG(outIntfUtil)

rule.description: Detects that interface utilization of a network IPS device has reached a warning level (utilization between 60% and 80% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval.

eventFilters.groupConstraint: ((AVG(inIntfUtil) >= 60 AND AVG(inIntfUtil) <= 80) OR (AVG(outIntfUtil) >= 60 AND AVG(outIntfUtil) <= 80)) AND COUNT(*) >= 2
eventFilters.name: IntfUtilWarn
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_NET_INTF_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Network) AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS) AND intfName NOT IN ("lo","Null0")

rule.name: Network IPS Intf Util Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfUtilWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = IntfUtilWarn.hostName, intfName = IntfUtilWarn.intfName, inIntfUtil = IntfUtilWarn.AVG(inIntfUtil),outIntfUtil = IntfUtilWarn.AVG(outIntfUtil)

rule.description: Detects that interface utilization of a network IPS device has reached a critical level (utilization greater than 80% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval.

eventFilters.name: IntfUtilCrit
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_NET_INTF_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Network) AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS) AND intfName NOT CONTAIN "Loopback" AND intfName NOT IN ("lo","Null0")

rule.name: Network IPS Intf Util Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfUtilCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = IntfUtilCrit.hostName, intfName = IntfUtilCrit.intfName, inIntfUtil = IntfUtilCrit.AVG(inIntfUtil),outIntfUtil = IntfUtilCrit.AVG(outIntfUtil)

rule.description: Detects that interface utilization of a server has reached a warning level (utilization between 30% and 50% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.groupConstraint: ((AVG(inIntfUtil) >= 30 AND AVG(inIntfUtil) <= 50) OR (AVG(outIntfUtil) >= 30 AND AVG(outIntfUtil) <= 50)) AND COUNT(*) >= 2
eventFilters.name: IntfUtilWarn
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_NET_INTF_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND hostIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS) AND intfName NOT CONTAIN "Loopback" AND intfName NOT IN ("lo","Null0")

rule.name: Server Intf Util Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfUtilWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = IntfUtilWarn.hostName, intfName = IntfUtilWarn.intfName, inIntfUtil = IntfUtilWarn.AVG(inIntfUtil),outIntfUtil = IntfUtilWarn.AVG(outIntfUtil)

rule.description: Detects that interface utilization of a network device has reached a critical level (utilization greater than 50% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.name: IntfUtilCrit
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_NET_INTF_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND hostIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS) AND intfName NOT CONTAIN "Loopback" AND intfName NOT IN ("lo","Null0")

rule.name: Server Intf Util Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfUtilCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = IntfUtilCrit.hostName, intfName = IntfUtilCrit.intfName, inIntfUtil = IntfUtilCrit.AVG(inIntfUtil),outIntfUtil = IntfUtilCrit.AVG(outIntfUtil)

rule.description: Detects that a network device interface error has reached a warning level (utilization between 1% and 5% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.groupConstraint: AVG(inIntfPktErrPct) >= 1 AND AVG(inIntfPktErrPct) <= 5 OR AVG(outIntfPktErrPct) >= 1 AND AVG(outIntfPktErrPct) <= 5 AND COUNT(*) >= 2
eventFilters.name: IntfErrorWarn

rule.name: Network Intf Error Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfErrorWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = IntfErrorWarn.hostName, intfName = IntfErrorWarn.intfName,inIntfPktErrPct = IntfErrorWarn.AVG(inIntfPktErrPct), outIntfPktErrPct = IntfErrorWarn.AVG(outIntfPktErrPct)

rule.description: Detects that a network device interface errors has reached a critical level (greater than 5% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: Network Intf Error Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfErrorCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = IntfErrorCrit.hostName, intfName = IntfErrorCrit.intfName, inIntfPktErrPct = IntfErrorCrit.AVG(inIntfPktErrPct), outIntfPktErrPct = IntfErrorCrit.AVG(outIntfPktErrPct)

rule.description: Detects that a server interface error has reached a warning level (utilization between 1% and 5% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.groupConstraint: AVG(inIntfPktErrPct) >= 1 AND AVG(inIntfPktErrPct) <= 5 OR AVG(outIntfPktErrPct) >= 1 AND AVG(outIntfPktErrPct) <= 5 AND COUNT(*) >= 2
eventFilters.name: IntfErrorWarn

rule.name: Server Intf Error Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfErrorWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = IntfErrorWarn.hostName, intfName = IntfErrorWarn.intfName,inIntfPktErrPct = IntfErrorWarn.AVG(inIntfPktErrPct), outIntfPktErrPct = IntfErrorWarn.AVG(outIntfPktErrPct)

rule.description: Detects that a server interface errors has reached a critical level (greater than 5% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: Server Intf Error Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfErrorCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = IntfErrorCrit.hostName, intfName = IntfErrorCrit.intfName, inIntfPktErrPct = IntfErrorCrit.AVG(inIntfPktErrPct), outIntfPktErrPct = IntfErrorCrit.AVG(outIntfPktErrPct)

rule.description: Detects that virtual server CPU ready percent has reached a warning level (between 20% and 25% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: Virtual Machine CPU Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = VMCPUMedium.hostIpAddr,hostName = VMCPUMedium.hostName,phyMachIpAddr = VMCPUMedium.phyMachIpAddr,phyMachName = VMCPUMedium.phyMachName,cpuReadyPct = VMCPUMedium.AVG(cpuReadyPct)

rule.description: Detects that virtual server CPU ready percent has reached a critical level (greater than 25% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: Virtual Machine CPU Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = VMCPUHigh.hostIpAddr,hostName = VMCPUHigh.hostName,phyMachIpAddr = VMCPUHigh.phyMachIpAddr,phyMachName = VMCPUHigh.phyMachName,cpuReadyPct = VMCPUHigh.AVG(cpuReadyPct)

rule.description: Detects that virtual machine memory has reached a warning level based on swapping rate between 1MBps and 1.5MBps based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: Virtual Machine Memory Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = VMMemMedium.hostIpAddr,hostName = VMMemMedium.hostName,phyMachIpAddr = VMMemMedium.phyMachIpAddr,phyMachName = VMMemMedium.phyMachName,swapReadKBytesPerSec = VMMemMedium.AVG(swapReadKBytesPerSec)

rule.description: Detects that virtual machine memory has reached a warning level based on swapping rate greater than 1.5MBps based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: Virtual Machine Memory Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = VMMemHigh.hostIpAddr,hostName = VMMemHigh.hostName,phyMachIpAddr = VMMemHigh.phyMachIpAddr,phyMachName = VMMemHigh.phyMachName,swapReadKBytesPerSec = VMMemHigh.AVG(swapReadKBytesPerSec)

rule.description: Detects that ESX CPU utilization has reached a warning level (between 75% and 95% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: ESX CPU Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ESXCPUWarn.hostIpAddr,hostName = ESXCPUWarn.hostName,cpuUtil = ESXCPUWarn.AVG(cpuUtil)

rule.description: Detects that ESX CPU utilization has reached a critical level (greater than 95% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: ESX CPU Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ESXCPUCrit.hostIpAddr,hostName = ESXCPUCrit.hostName,cpuUtil = ESXCPUCrit.AVG(cpuUtil)

rule.description: Detects that ESX memory utilization has reached a warning level (greater than 85% and swap rate between 1MBps and 1.5 MBps) based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.groupConstraint: AVG(memUtil) >= 85 AND AVG(swapReadKBytesPerSec) >= 1000 AND AVG(swapReadKBytesPerSec) <= 1500 AND COUNT(*) >= 2
eventFilters.name: ESXMemWarn

rule.name: ESX Memory Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ESXMemWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = ESXMemWarn.hostName, memUtil = ESXMemWarn.AVG(memUtil), swapReadKBytesPerSec = ESXMemWarn.AVG(swapReadKBytesPerSec)

rule.description: Detects that ESX CPU utilization has reached a critical level (greater than 95% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: ESX Memory Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ESXMemCrit.hostIpAddr,hostName = ESXMemCrit.hostName, memUtil = ESXMemCrit.AVG(memUtil), swapReadKBytesPerSec = ESXMemCrit.AVG(swapReadKBytesPerSec)

rule.description: Detects that ESX disk I/O utilization has reached a warning level - average Disk IO Latency between 20ms and 50ms based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.groupConstraint: AVG(guestDiskRdLatency) >= 20 AND AVG(guestDiskRdLatency) <= 50 AND AVG(guestDiskWrLatency) >= 20 AND AVG(guestDiskWrLatency) < 50 AND COUNT(*) >= 2
eventFilters.name: ESXDiskWarn

rule.name: ESX Disk I/O Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ESXDiskWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = ESXDiskWarn.hostName, diskAdapter = ESXDiskWarn.diskAdapter, guestDiskRdLatency = ESXDiskWarn.AVG(guestDiskRdLatency), guestDiskWrLatency = ESXDiskWarn.AVG(guestDiskWrLatency)

rule.description: Detects that ESX disk I/O utilization has reached a critical level - average Disk IO Latency greater than 50ms based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: ESX Disk I/O Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ESXDiskCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = ESXDiskCrit.hostName, diskAdapter = ESXDiskCrit.diskAdapter, guestDiskRdLatency = ESXDiskCrit.AVG(guestDiskRdLatency), guestDiskWrLatency = ESXDiskCrit.AVG(guestDiskWrLatency)

rule.description: Detects that ESX network I/O utilization has reached a warning level - average network interface utilization between 35% and 50% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.groupConstraint: ((AVG(inIntfUtil) >= 35 AND AVG(inIntfUtil) <= 50) OR (AVG(outIntfUtil) >= 35 AND AVG(outIntfUtil) <= 50)) AND COUNT(*) >= 2
eventFilters.name: ESXIntfWarn

rule.name: ESX Network I/O Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ESXIntfWarn.hostIpAddr, hostName = ESXIntfWarn.hostName, vSwitch = ESXIntfWarn.vSwitch, inIntfUtil = ESXIntfWarn.AVG(inIntfUtil), outIntfUtil = ESXIntfWarn.AVG(outIntfUtil)

rule.description: Detects that ESX network I/O utilization has reached a critical level - average network interface utilization greater than 50% based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval
rule.name: ESX Network I/O Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = ESXIntfCrit.hostIpAddr, hostName = ESXIntfCrit.hostName, vSwitch = ESXIntfCrit.vSwitch, inIntfUtil = ESXIntfCrit.AVG(inIntfUtil), outIntfUtil = ESXIntfCrit.AVG(outIntfUtil)

rule.description: Detects multiple logon failures at a network device - 5 consecutive failures in a 10 minute period. This rule triggers for network devices that do not report a source IP address.

eventFilters.name: ExcessNetLoginFailure
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Network) AND srcIpAddr IS NULL

rule.name: Multiple Admin Login Failures: Net Device (no Source IP)
rule.incidentAttrs: destIpAddr = ExcessNetLoginFailure.reptDevIpAddr, user = ExcessNetLoginFailure.user, incidentCount = ExcessNetLoginFailure.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects excessive logon failures at a network device - 5 consecutive failures in a 10 minute period. This rule triggers for network devices that report a source IP address.

eventFilters.name: ExcessNetLoginFailure
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonFailure) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Network) AND srcIpAddr IS NOT NULL

rule.name: Multiple Admin Login Failures: Net Device
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessNetLoginFailure.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = ExcessNetLoginFailure.reptDevIpAddr, user = ExcessNetLoginFailure.user, incidentCount = ExcessNetLoginFailure.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects repeating occurrences of multiple logon failures at a network device
rule.name: Repeated Admin Multiple Login Failures: Net Device
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = RepeatExcessNetLoginFailure.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = RepeatExcessNetLoginFailure.destIpAddr, incidentCount =RepeatExcessNetLoginFailure.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects excessive logon failures at a server - 5 consecutive failures in a 10 minute period
rule.name: Multiple Logon Failures: Server
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessServerLoginFailure.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = ExcessServerLoginFailure.reptDevIpAddr, user = ExcessServerLoginFailure.user, incidentCount = ExcessServerLoginFailure.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects repeating occurrences of multiple logon failures at a server from the same user.
rule.name: Repeated Multiple Logon Failures: Server
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = RepeatExcessServerLoginFailure.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = RepeatExcessServerLoginFailure.destIpAddr, incidentCount = RepeatExcessServerLoginFailure.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects excessive privileged logon failures at a server - 3 consecutive failures in a 10 minute period
rule.name: Multiple Privileged Logon Failures: Server
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessPrivLoginFailure.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = ExcessPrivLoginFailure.reptDevIpAddr, user = ExcessPrivLoginFailure.user, incidentCount = ExcessPrivLoginFailure.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects excessive application logon failures - 5 consecutive failures in a 10 minute period. Application logsons include the one that may require authentication for accessing the authentication, such as HTTP, SNMP, FTP, POP3, IMAP etc.
rule.name: Multiple Logon Failures: Web Server
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessWebLoginFailure.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = ExcessWebLoginFailure.reptDevIpAddr, user = ExcessWebLoginFailure.user, incidentCount = ExcessWebLoginFailure.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects repeating occurrences of multiple application logon failures
rule.name: Repeated Multiple Logon Failures: Web Server
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = Filter_Rule_Access_16_1.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = Filter_Rule_Access_16_1.destIpAddr, incidentCount = Filter_Rule_Access_16_1.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects excessive application logon failures - 5 consecutive failures in a 10 minute period. Application logsons include the one that may require authentication for accessing the authentication, such as HTTP, SNMP, FTP, POP3, IMAP etc.
rule.name: Multiple Logon Failures: Database
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessDBLoginFailure1.srcIpAddr, srcName = ExcessDBLoginFailure2.srcName, destIpAddr = ExcessDBLoginFailure1.reptDevIpAddr, user = ExcessDBLoginFailure1.user, incidentCount = ExcessDBLoginFailure1.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects repeating occurrences of multiple application logon failures
rule.name: Repeated Multiple Logon Failures: Database
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = Filter_Rule_Access_16_1.srcIpAddr, srcName = Filter_Rule_Access_16_2.srcName, destIpAddr = Filter_Rule_Access_16_1.destIpAddr, incidentCount = Filter_Rule_Access_16_1.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects excessive application logon failures - 5 consecutive failures in a 10 minute period. Application logsons include the one that may require authentication for accessing the authentication, such as HTTP, SNMP, FTP, POP3, IMAP etc.

eventFilters.name: ExcessMiscAppLoginFailure1
eventFilters.singleConstraint: srcIpAddr IS NOT NULL AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AppLogonFailure) AND eventType NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AAALogonFailure)

eventFilters.name: ExcessMiscAppLoginFailure2
eventFilters.singleConstraint: srcIpAddr IS NULL AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AppLogonFailure) AND eventType NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AAALogonFailure)

rule.name: Multiple Logon Failures: Misc App
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessMiscAppLoginFailure1.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = ExcessMiscAppLoginFailure1.reptDevIpAddr, user = ExcessMiscAppLoginFailure1.user, incidentCount = ExcessMiscAppLoginFailure1.COUNT(*), destIpAddr = ExcessMiscAppLoginFailure2.reptDevIpAddr, user = ExcessMiscAppLoginFailure2.user, incidentCount = ExcessMiscAppLoginFailure2.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects repeating occurrences of multiple application logon failures

eventFilters.name: RepeatExcessMiscAppLoginFailure1
eventFilters.singleConstraint: srcIpAddr IS NOT NULL AND eventType = "PH_RULE_EXCESS_FAILED_LOGON_APPL"

rule.name: Repeated Multiple Logon Failures: Misc App
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = RepeatExcessMiscAppLoginFailure1.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = RepeatExcessMiscAppLoginFailure1.destIpAddr, incidentCount = RepeatExcessMiscAppLoginFailure1.COUNT(*), destIpAddr = RepeatExcessMiscAppLoginFailure2.destIpAddr, incidentCount = RepeatExcessMiscAppLoginFailure2.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects multiple domain logon failures - 5 consecutive failures in a 10 minute period
rule.name: Multiple Logon Failures: Domain
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessDomainLoginFailure.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = ExcessDomainLoginFailure.reptDevIpAddr, domain = ExcessDomainLoginFailure.domain, user = ExcessDomainLoginFailure.user, incidentCount = ExcessDomainLoginFailure.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects repeating occurrences of multiple domain logon failures
rule.name: Repeated Multiple Logon Failures: Domain
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = RepeatExcessDomainLoginFailure.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = RepeatExcessDomainLoginFailure.destIpAddr, incidentCount = RepeatExcessDomainLoginFailure.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects multiple VPN logon failures - 5 consecutive failures in a 10 minute period
rule.name: Multiple Logon Failures: VPN
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessVPNLoginFailure.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = ExcessVPNLoginFailure.reptDevIpAddr, user = ExcessVPNLoginFailure.user, incidentCount = ExcessVPNLoginFailure.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects repeating occurrences of excessive VPN logon failures
rule.name: Repeated Multiple Logon Failures: VPN
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = RepeatExcessVPNLoginFailure.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = RepeatExcessVPNLoginFailure.destIpAddr, incidentCount = RepeatExcessVPNLoginFailure.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects multiple Wireless logon failures - 5 consecutive failures in a 10 minute period
rule.name: Multiple Logon Failures: WLAN
rule.incidentAttrs: srcMACAddr = ExcessWLANLoginFailure.srcMACAddr, destIpAddr = ExcessWLANLoginFailure.reptDevIpAddr, user = ExcessWLANLoginFailure.user, incidentCount = ExcessWLANLoginFailure.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects repeating occurrences of excessive wireless LAN logon failures
rule.name: Repeated Multiple Logon Failures: WLAN
rule.incidentAttrs: srcMACAddr = RepeatExcessWLANLoginFailure.srcMACAddr, destIpAddr = RepeatExcessWLANLoginFailure.destIpAddr, incidentCount = RepeatExcessWLANLoginFailure.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects account lockout caused by excessive logon failures
rule.name: Domain Account Lockout
rule.incidentAttrs: destIpAddr = DomainAcctLockout.reptDevIpAddr, user = DomainAcctLockout.user, incidentCount = DomainAcctLockout.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects account lockout caused by excessive logon failures
rule.name: Network Device Account Lockout
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = NetDevAcctLockout.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = NetDevAcctLockout.reptDevIpAddr, user = NetDevAcctLockout.user, incidentCount = NetDevAcctLockout.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects account lockout caused by excessive logon failures

eventFilters.name: ServerAcctLockout
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostAccountLocked) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND reptDevIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_DOMAIN_CONTROLLER)

rule.name: Server Account Lockout
rule.incidentAttrs: destIpAddr = ServerAcctLockout.reptDevIpAddr, user = ServerAcctLockout.user, incidentCount = ServerAcctLockout.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects logon attempts to disabled accounts
rule.name: Disabled Account Logon Attempt
rule.incidentAttrs: destIpAddr = DisabledAcctLogin.reptDevIpAddr, user = DisabledAcctLogin.user, incidentCount = DisabledAcctLogin.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects logon attempts at times which are not permitted by policy
rule.name: Logon Time Restriction Violation
rule.incidentAttrs: destIpAddr = LoginTimeViolation.reptDevIpAddr, user = LoginTimeViolation.user, incidentCount = LoginTimeViolation.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects the same source having excessive logon failures at distinct hosts
rule.name: Multiple Logon Failures: Same Src, Multiple Hosts
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = PasswordScan_ManyDest.srcIpAddr, incidentCount = PasswordScan_ManyDest.COUNT (DISTINCT (destIpAddr))

rule.description: Detects same source having excessive login failures at the same destination host but multiple distinct accounts are used during the logon failure
rule.name: Multiple Logon Failures: Same Src and Dest, Multiple Accounts
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = PasswordScan_SameDest_ManyAcct.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = PasswordScan_SameDest_ManyAcct.destIpAddr, incidentCount = PasswordScan_SameDest_ManyAcct.COUNT (DISTINCT (user))

rule.description: Detects an unusual condition where a source has authentication failures at a host but that is not followed by a successful authentication at the same host within the same day

eventFilters.name: SuccessLogin
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostLogonSuccess, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HostPrivLogonSuccess, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_DomainLogonSuccess, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_VPNLogonSuccess, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_WirelessLogonSuccess, Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AppLogonSuccess)

rule.globalConstraint: FailedLogin.destIpAddr = SuccessLogin.reptDevIpAddr, FailedLogin.srcIpAddr = SuccessLogin.srcIpAddr, FailedLogin.user = SuccessLogin.user
rule.name: Suspicious Logon Failure: no following successful login
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = FailedLogin.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = FailedLogin.destIpAddr, user = FailedLogin.user

rule.description: Detects a high severity vulnerability reported by a vulnerability scanner

eventFilters.name: ScannerHighSev
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Vulnerability) AND reptVendor IN ("Qualys", "Nessus", "nCircle") AND eventSeverity >= 8

rule.name: Scanner found severe vulnerability
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName = ScannerHighSev.hostName, vulnName = ScannerHighSev.vulnName

rule.description: Detects that host anti-virus or content inspection devices found a virus but could not rremediate it
rule.name: Virus found but not remediated
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = VirusFound.hostIpAddr

rule.description: Detects that host anti-virus or content inspection devices found a Spam/Malicious Mail Attachment but could not rremediate it. The sender is sending to 5 or more distinct receiver mail addresses
rule.name: Spam/Malicious Mail Attachment found but not remediated
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = AttachFound.hostIpAddr, senderMailAddr = AttachFound.senderMailAddr

rule.description: Detects that host anti-virus or content inspection devices found a spyware but could not remediate it
rule.name: Spyware found but not remediated
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = SpywareFound.hostIpAddr

rule.description: Detects a host performing a port scan - this involves excessive half open TCP connections from the same source to many distinct ports on a host in a short period of time. The thresholds are at least 20 distinct ports in a 2 minute window

eventFilters.name: Filter1
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "IOS-NETFLOW-BI" AND srcDestTCPFlags = 2 AND ipProto = 6 AND srcIpPort >= 1024 AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS)

rule.name: Heavy TCP Port Scan: Single Host
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = Filter1.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = Filter1.destIpAddr, incidentCount = Filter1.COUNT (DISTINCT (destIpPort))

rule.description: Detects that a source is doing port scans on multiple hosts. The thresholds are port scans on at least 5 hosts in 15 minute window
rule.name: Heavy TCP Port Scan: Multiple Hosts
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = Filter1.srcIpAddr, incidentCount = Filter1.COUNT (DISTINCT (destIpAddr))

rule.description: Detects excessive UDP connections from the same source to many distinct ports on the same destination in a short period of time

eventFilters.name: Filter1
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "IOS-NETFLOW-BI" AND ipProto = 17 AND srcIpPort >= 1024 AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS)

rule.name: Heavy UDP Port Scan: Single Host
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = Filter1.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = Filter1.destIpAddr, incidentCount = Filter1.COUNT (DISTINCT (destIpPort))

rule.description: Detects that a source is doing UDP port scans on multiple hosts. The thresholds are port scans on at least 5 hosts in 15 minute window
rule.name: Heavy UDP Port Scan: Multiple Hosts
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = Filter1.srcIpAddr, incidentCount = Filter1.COUNT (DISTINCT (destIpAddr))

rule.description: Detects an usually high frequency of ICMP destination unreachable packets between the same source and destination - this indicates routing error

eventFilters.name: ExcessICMPUnreach
eventFilters.singleConstraint: ipProto = 1 AND icmpType = 3 AND eventType IN ("IOS-NETFLOW-BI", Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_PermitTraffic,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_DenyTraffic) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS)

rule.name: Excessive ICMP Unreachables
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessICMPUnreach.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr =ExcessICMPUnreach.destIpAddr

rule.description: Detects a device does not respond to ping - 10 out of 10 ping packets are lost - either the host is down or there is a routing problem
rule.name: Network Device Down - no ping response
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = AllPingLossNet.hostIpAddr

rule.description: Detects a host with degraded ping response - more than 50% packet loss and more than 100 ms avg response time
rule.name: Network Device Degraded - Lossy Ping Response
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = PartPingLossNet.hostIpAddr,pktLossPct=PartPingLossNet.AVG(pktLossPct))

rule.description: Detects a device does not respond to ping - 10 out of 10 ping packets are lost - either the host is down or there is a routing problem
rule.name: Server Down - No Ping Response
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = AllPingLossSrv.hostIpAddr

rule.description: Detects a host with degraded ping response - more than 50% packet loss and more than 100 ms avg response time
rule.name: Server Degraded - Lossy Ping Response
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = PartPingLossSrv.hostIpAddr,pktLossPct=PartPingLossSrv.AVG(pktLossPct)

rule.description: Detects that a network interface of a network device is staying down - that is didn't come up within 5 minutes of going down
rule.name: Network Device Interface Staying Down
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfDownNetDev.hostIpAddr,intfName = IntfDownNetDev.intfName

rule.description: Detects that a network interface of a server stays down - that is didn't come up within 5 minutes of going down
rule.name: Server Network Interface Staying Down
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfDownSrv.hostIpAddr, intfName = IntfDownSrv.intfName

rule.description: Detects that a network interface of a network device is flapping - that is, coming up and down more than 3 times in 15 minutes. This may indicate hardware issues.
rule.name: Network Device Interface Flapping
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfDownNetDev.hostIpAddr, intfName = IntfDownNetDev.intfName

rule.description: Detects that a network interface of a server is flapping - that is, coming up and down more than 3 times in 15 minutes. This may indicate hardware issues.
rule.name: Server Network Interface Flapping
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = IntfDownSrv.hostIpAddr, intfName = IntfDownSrv.intfName

rule.description: Detects half/Full duplex mismatch on an network interface. This indicates configuration issues.
rule.name: Network Interface Duplex Mismatch
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = IntfDuplexMismatch.reptDevIpAddr,srcIntfName = IntfDuplexMismatch.srcIntfName,destName = IntfDuplexMismatch.destName,destIntfName = IntfDuplexMismatch.destIntfName

rule.description: Detects a service suddenly went down from up state and is no longer responding to synthetic transaction monitoring probes.
rule.name: Service Down - No Response to STM
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName=AppDown.hostName,hostIpAddr=AppDown.hostIpAddr,appPort=AppDown.appPort,endUserMonitorName=AppDown.endUserMonitorName

rule.description: Detects that an important server process staying down - that is didn't come up within 5 minutes of going down

eventFilters.name: AppDownSrv
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_PROC_STOP" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND ((appName CONTAIN "Oracle Database") OR (appName CONTAIN "IBM DB2") OR (appName CONTAIN "Microsoft SQL") OR (appName CONTAIN "MySQL Database") OR (appName CONTAIN "Postgress Database") OR (appName CONTAIN "Sybase Adaptive") OR (appName CONTAIN "Microsoft IIS") OR (appName CONTAIN "Tomcat Appserver") OR (appName CONTAIN "Apache Webserver")OR (appName CONTAIN "MS Exchange") OR (appName CONTAIN "Sendmail") OR (appName CONTAIN "Postfix"))

eventFilters.name: AppUpSrv
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_PROC_START" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND ((appName CONTAIN "Oracle Database") OR (appName CONTAIN "IBM DB2") OR (appName CONTAIN "Microsoft SQL") OR (appName CONTAIN "MySQL Database") OR (appName CONTAIN "Postgress Database") OR (appName CONTAIN "Sybase Adaptive") OR (appName CONTAIN "Microsoft IIS") OR (appName CONTAIN "Tomcat Appserver") OR (appName CONTAIN "Apache Webserver")OR (appName CONTAIN "MS Exchange") OR (appName CONTAIN "Sendmail") OR (appName CONTAIN "Postfix"))

rule.name: Important Application Stopped
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = AppDownSrv.hostIpAddr, appName = AppDownSrv.appName, swProcName = AppDownSrv.swProcName

rule.description: Detects a service staying down - that is went from up to down and did not come up and is no longer responding to end user monitoring probes.
rule.globalConstraint: AppStillDown.hostName = AppDown.hostName, AppStillDown.hostIpAddr = AppDown.hostIpAddr, AppStillDown.appPort = AppDown.appPort, AppStillDown.endUserMonitorName = AppDown.endUserMonitorName
rule.name: Service Staying Down - No Response to STM
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName=AppDown.hostName,hostIpAddr=AppDown.hostIpAddr,appPort=AppDown.appPort,endUserMonitorName=AppDown.endUserMonitorName

rule.description: Detects that the response time of a end user monitored service is greater than a defined threshold (average over 3 samples in 15 minutes is more than 5 seconds)
rule.name: Service Degraded - Slow Response to STM
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName=ResponseHigh.hostName,hostIpAddr=ResponseHigh.hostIpAddr,appPort=ResponseHigh.appPort,endUserMonitorName=ResponseHigh.endUserMonitorName,endUserMonitorStep=ResponseHigh.endUserMonitorStep,appResponseTimeMSec=ResponseHigh.AVG(appResponseTimeMSec)

rule.description: Detects a network device hardware issue that is of warning criticality.

eventFilters.name: HwIssueWarn
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HwProblem) AND eventSeverityCat = "MEDIUM" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Network)

rule.name: Network Device Hardware Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName=HwIssueWarn.hostName,hostIpAddr=HwIssueWarn.hostIpAddr,hwComponentName=HwIssueWarn.hwComponentName,hwComponentStatus = HwIssueWarn.hwComponentStatus

rule.description: Detects a critical network device hardware alert.

eventFilters.name: HwIssueCrit
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HwProblem) AND eventSeverityCat = "HIGH" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Network)

rule.name: Network Device Hardware Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName=HwIssueCrit.hostName,hostIpAddr=HwIssueCrit.hostIpAddr,hwComponentName=HwIssueCrit.hwComponentName,hwComponentStatus = HwIssueCrit.hwComponentStatus

rule.description: Detects a server hardware issue that is of warning criticality.

eventFilters.name: HwIssueWarn
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HwProblem) AND eventSeverityCat = "MEDIUM" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server)

rule.name: Server Hardware Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName=HwIssueWarn.hostName,hostIpAddr=HwIssueWarn.hostIpAddr,hwComponentName=HwIssueWarn.hwComponentName,hwComponentStatus = HwIssueWarn.hwComponentStatus

rule.description: Detects a critical server hardware alert.

eventFilters.name: HwIssueCrit
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HwProblem) AND eventSeverityCat = "HIGH" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server)

rule.name: Server Hardware Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName=HwIssueCrit.hostName,hostIpAddr=HwIssueCrit.hostIpAddr,hwComponentName=HwIssueCrit.hwComponentName,hwComponentStatus = HwIssueCrit.hwComponentStatus

rule.description: Detects a low TCP/UDP port on a server staying down - that is, went from up to down and did not come up in 10 min

eventFilters.name: PortDown
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_PORT_CLOSE" AND ipPort <= 1024 AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server)

eventFilters.name: PortStillDown
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_PORT_OPEN" AND ipPort <= 1024 AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server)

rule.globalConstraint: PortStillDown.hostName = PortDown.hostName, PortStillDown.hostIpAddr = PortDown.hostIpAddr, PortStillDown.serviceName = PortDown.serviceName, PortStillDown.ipPort = PortDown.ipPort, PortStillDown.ipProto = PortDown.ipProto
rule.name: Server Network Low Port Staying Down
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName=PortDown.hostName,hostIpAddr=PortDown.hostIpAddr,serviceName=PortDown.serviceName,ipPort=PortDown.ipPort,ipProto=PortDown.ipProto

rule.description: Detects that a BGP neighbor is down
rule.name: BGP Neighbor Down
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = BGPDown.reptDevIpAddr,destIpAddr = BGPDown.destIpAddr

rule.description: Detects that a OSPF neighbor is down
rule.name: OSPF Neighbor Down
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = OSPFDown.reptDevIpAddr,srcIntfName = OSPFDown.srcIntfName,destIpAddr = OSPFDown.destIpAddr

rule.description: Detects a storage hardware issue that is of warning criticality.

eventFilters.name: HwIssueWarn
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HwProblem) AND eventSeverityCat = "MEDIUM" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Storage)

rule.name: Storage Hardware Warning
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName=HwIssueWarn.hostName,hostIpAddr=HwIssueWarn.hostIpAddr,hwComponentName=HwIssueWarn.hwComponentName,hwComponentStatus = HwIssueWarn.hwComponentStatus

rule.description: Detects a critical storage hardware alert.

eventFilters.name: HwIssueCrit
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_HwProblem) AND eventSeverityCat = "HIGH" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Storage)

rule.name: Storage Hardware Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName=HwIssueCrit.hostName,hostIpAddr=HwIssueCrit.hostIpAddr,hwComponentName=HwIssueCrit.hwComponentName,hwComponentStatus = HwIssueCrit.hwComponentStatus

rule.description: Detects that a host has logged in but not registered
rule.name: Unregistered EMC Clariion Host
rule.incidentAttrs: srcName=UnregHost.srcName,srcIpAddr=UnregHost.srcIpAddr,srcWWN=UnregHost.srcWWN,destName=UnregHost.destName,spPortName=UnregHost.spPortName

rule.description: Detects that key UPS operational etrics are outside of normal operational range

eventFilters.groupConstraint: COUNT (*) >= 2 AND ( AVG(upsAdvOutputFreq) <= 55 OR AVG(upsAdvOutputFreq) >= 65 OR AVG(upsAdvOutputVoltage) < 110 OR AVG(upsAdvOutputVoltage) > 125 OR AVG(upsAdvOutputLoad) >= 50)
eventFilters.name: LowBattery1

rule.name: UPS Battery Metrics Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = LowBattery1.hostIpAddr, hostName = LowBattery1.hostName, upsAdvOutputFreq = LowBattery1.AVG(upsAdvOutputFreq), upsAdvOutputVoltage = LowBattery1.AVG(upsAdvOutputVoltage), upsAdvOutputLoad = LowBattery1.AVG(upsAdvOutputLoad)

rule.description: Detects that key UPS battery status are reflecting critical state

eventFilters.groupConstraint: COUNT (*) >= 1 AND ( AVG(upsBatteryStatus) > 2 OR AVG(upsRemainBatteryChargePct) < 50 OR AVG(upsTimeOnBattery) >= 120 OR AVG(upsBasicOutputStatus) > 2 OR AVG(upsReplaceBatteryIndicator) > 1)
eventFilters.name: LowBattery2
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_UPS_METRIC" AND (upsBatteryStatus = 3 OR upsBatteryStatus = 4 OR upsRemainBatteryChargePct < 50 OR upsTimeOnBattery >= 120 OR upsBasicOutputStatus != 2 OR upsReplaceBatteryIndicator = 2)

rule.name: UPS Battery Status Critical
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = LowBattery2.hostIpAddr, hostName = LowBattery2.hostName, upsTimeOnBattery = LowBattery2.AVG(upsTimeOnBattery), upsBatteryStatus = LowBattery2.AVG(upsBatteryStatus), upsRemainBatteryChargePct = LowBattery2.AVG(upsRemainBatteryChargePct), upsReplaceBatteryIndicator = LowBattery2.AVG(upsReplaceBatteryIndicator), upsBasicOutputStatus = LowBattery2.AVG(upsBasicOutputStatus)

rule.description: Detects that HVAC temperature is less than 5 degree Fahrenheit from upper threshold
rule.name: HVAC temp high
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = HVAC_Hot.hostIpAddr, hostName = HVAC_Hot.hostName, envTempOffHighDegF = HVAC_Hot.AVG(envTempOffHighDegF)

rule.description: Detects that HVAC temperature is less than 5 degree Fahrenheit from the lower threshold
rule.name: HVAC temp low
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = HVAC_Cold.hostIpAddr, hostName = HVAC_Cold.hostName, envTempOffLowDegF = HVAC_Cold.AVG(envTempOffLowDegF)

rule.description: Detects that HVAC relative humidity is less than 5 units from upper threshold
rule.name: HVAC humidity high
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = HVAC_Humid.hostIpAddr, hostName = HVAC_Humid.hostName, envHumidityOffHigh = HVAC_Humid.AVG(envHumidityOffHigh)

rule.description: Detects that HVAC relative humidity is less than 5 units from lower threshold
rule.name: HVAC humidity low
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = HVAC_Humid.hostIpAddr, hostName = HVAC_Humid.hostName, envHumidityOffLow = HVAC_Humid.AVG(envHumidityOffLow)

rule.description: Detects that Voltage total harmonic distortion is more than 0.15 pct

eventFilters.groupConstraint: COUNT (*) >= 2 AND (AVG(outputVxTHD) >= 15 OR AVG(outputVyTHD) > 15 OR AVG(outputVzTHD) >= 15)
eventFilters.name: FPC_VHD_high

rule.name: FPC Voltage THD high
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = FPC_VHD_high.hostIpAddr, hostName = FPC_VHD_high.hostName, outputVxTHD = FPC_VHD_high.AVG(outputVxTHD), outputVyTHD = FPC_VHD_high.AVG(outputVyTHD), outputVzTHD = FPC_VHD_high.AVG(outputVzTHD)

rule.description: Detects that current total harmonic distortion is more than 0.15 pct

eventFilters.groupConstraint: COUNT (*) >= 2 AND (AVG(outputLxTHD) >= 5 OR AVG(outputLyTHD) > 5 OR AVG(outputLzTHD) >= 5)
eventFilters.name: FPC_CHD_high

rule.name: FPC Current THD high
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = FPC_CHD_high.hostIpAddr, hostName = FPC_CHD_high.hostName, outputLxTHD = FPC_CHD_high.AVG(outputLxTHD), outputLyTHD = FPC_CHD_high.AVG(outputLyTHD), outputLzTHD = FPC_CHD_high.AVG(outputLzTHD)

rule.description: Detects that ground current is more than 0.12 amps
rule.name: FPC ground current high
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = FPC_GC_high.hostIpAddr, hostName = FPC_GC_high.hostName, groundCurrentAmps = FPC_GC_high.AVG(groundCurrentAmps)

rule.description: Detects multiple IPS events from the same source IP in a short period of time - the source IP may have been infected

eventFilters.name: DistinctIPSEvents
eventFilters.singleConstraint: (reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS) OR (reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS) AND eventType CONTAIN "Snort-")) AND eventSeverity >= 7

rule.name: Multiple Distinct IPS Events From Same Src
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = DistinctIPSEvents.srcIpAddr, incidentCount = DistinctIPSEvents.COUNT (DISTINCT (eventType))

rule.description: Detects multiple IPS scans from the same source IP in a short period of time.

eventFilters.name: IPSScan
eventFilters.singleConstraint: (reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS) OR (reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS) AND eventType CONTAIN "Snort-")) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Reconn)

rule.name: Multiple IPS Scans From Same Src
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = IPSScan.srcIpAddr, incidentCount = IPSScan.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects a high risk rating IPS exploit event. This is applicable for Cisco IPS.

eventFilters.name: IPSHighRR
eventFilters.singleConstraint: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS) AND eventType NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Logon,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Reconn) AND ipsEvRR >= 85

rule.name: High Risk Rating Cisco IPS Exploit
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = IPSHighRR.srcIpAddr, compEventType = IPSHighRR.eventType, compEventName = IPSHighRR.eventName, incidentCount = IPSHighRR.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects a high severity IPS exploit detected by non-Cisco IPS

eventFilters.name: NonCiscoIPSHighSev
eventFilters.singleConstraint: (reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS) OR (reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS) AND eventType CONTAIN "Snort-")) AND reptVendor != "Cisco" AND eventType NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Logon,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Reconn) AND eventSeverity >= 8

rule.name: High Severity IPS Exploit
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = NonCiscoIPSHighSev.srcIpAddr, compEventType = NonCiscoIPSHighSev.eventType, incidentCount = NonCiscoIPSHighSev.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects a high severity security exploit detected by non IPS devices

eventFilters.name: NonIPSHighSev
eventFilters.singleConstraint: reptDevIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_NETWORK_IPS,Group@PH_SYS_APP_NETWORK_IPS) AND eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Exploit,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_Malware,Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_UnusualTraffic) AND eventSeverity >= 8

rule.name: High Severity Security Exploit
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = NonIPSHighSev.srcIpAddr, incidentCount = NonIPSHighSev.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects degraded voip call quality (mos score between 2.2 and 3.5)
rule.name: Degraded VoIP Call Quality
rule.incidentAttrs: srcName = MediumCallQuality.srcName, destName = MediumCallQuality.destName, ipSLAProto= MediumCallQuality.ipSLAProto, codec = MediumCallQuality.codec

rule.description: Detects poor voip call quality (mos score less than 2.2)
rule.name: Poor VoIP Call Quality
rule.incidentAttrs: srcName = PoorCallQuality.srcName, destName = PoorCallQuality.destName, ipSLAProto= PoorCallQuality.ipSLAProto, codec = PoorCallQuality.codec

rule.description: Detects that the startup and running configurations of a network device (router or firewall) are different. This is achieved via logging in.
rule.name: Difference in Running and Startup Config
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = StartupRunDelta.hostIpAddr, hostName = StartupRunDelta.hostName, addedItem = StartupRunDelta.addedItem, deletedItem = StartupRunDelta.deletedItem

rule.description: Detects that the configuration of a network device (router or firewall) has changed. This is achieved via logging in and keeping track of the last change and requires the network devices to forward syslog to the AccelOps appliance.
rule.name: Startup Config Change (with login info)
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = login.srcIpAddr, hostIpAddr = delta.hostIpAddr, hostName = delta.hostName, addedItem = delta.addedItem, deletedItem = delta.deletedItem

rule.description: Detects user/group configuration in a domain controller. This rule would trigger on all changes made by any person. To prevent false positives, a restriction on the user attribute should be made by excluding the domain administrators.

eventFilters.name: DCUserGrpChange
eventFilters.singleConstraint: reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_DOMAIN_CONTROLLER) AND eventType IN ( Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_AccountChanged)

rule.name: Domain Controller User/Group Modification
rule.incidentAttrs: user = DCUserGrpChange.user, computer = DCUserGrpChange.computer, domain = DCUserGrpChange.domain, targetUser = DCUserGrpChange.targetUser, targetDomain = DCUserGrpChange.targetDomain

rule.description: Detects that the configuration of a network device (router or firewall) has changed. This is achieved via logging in and keeping track of the last change and requires the network device to forward syslog messages to the AccelOps appliance.
rule.name: Running Config Change (with login info)
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = login.srcIpAddr, hostIpAddr = delta.hostIpAddr, hostName = delta.hostName, addedItem = delta.addedItem, deletedItem = delta.deletedItem

rule.description: Detects that the configuration of a network device (router or firewall) has changed. This is achieved via logging in and keeping track of the last change
rule.name: Startup Config Change
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = delta.hostIpAddr, hostName = delta.hostName, addedItem = delta.addedItem, deletedItem = delta.deletedItem

rule.description: Detects that the configuration of a network device (router or firewall) has changed. This is achieved via logging in and keeping track of the last change
rule.name: Running Config Change
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = delta.hostIpAddr, hostName = delta.hostName, addedItem = delta.addedItem, deletedItem = delta.deletedItem

rule.description: Detects that a new software has been installed on a server or an existing software has been deleted.
rule.name: Server Installed Software Change
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = delta.hostIpAddr, hostName = delta.hostName, addedItem = delta.addedItem, deletedItem = delta.deletedItem

rule.description: Detects that a user modified either the content or the attributes of a file or directory
rule.name: Linux file change
rule.incidentAttrs: hostIpAddr = FileChange.reptDevIpAddr, user = FileChange.user, osObjType = FileChange.osObjType, osObjAction = FileChange.osObjAction, osObjName = FileChange.osObjName, targetOsObjType =FileChange.targetOsObjType, targetOsObjName = FileChange.targetOsObjName

rule.description: Detects excessive half-open TCP sessions from the same source to many distinct destinations in a short period of time. The threshold is 200 flows within 3 minutes. Scanning may be a precursor to exploits. However, network management and mapping tools often scan the network for discovery purposes and authorized scanners need to be blacklisted. P2P clients also exhibit this behavior when they attempt to establish connections to (non-existent) peers.

eventFilters.name: HostScanTCP
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "IOS-NETFLOW-BI" AND srcDestTCPFlags = 2 AND ipProto = 6 AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS)

rule.name: Heavy TCP Host Scan
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = HostScanTCP.srcIpAddr, incidentCount = HostScanTCP.COUNT (DISTINCT (destIpAddr))

rule.description: Detects excessive half-open TCP sessions from the same source to many distinct destinations and on the same destination port in a short period of time. The threshold is 200 flows within 3 minutes. A fixed destination port may indicate that the scanning host is attempting to find hosts on a well known port (with a vulnerability). Scanning may be a precursor to exploits. However, network management and mapping tools often scan the network for discovery purposes and authorized scanners need to be blacklisted. P2P clients also exhibit this behavior when they attempt to establish connections to (non-existent) peers.

eventFilters.name: HostScanFixedTCPPort
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "IOS-NETFLOW-BI" AND srcDestTCPFlags = 2 AND ipProto = 6 AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS)

rule.name: Heavy TCP Host Scan On Fixed Port
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = HostScanFixedTCPPort.srcIpAddr, destIpPort = HostScanFixedTCPPort.destIpPort, incidentCount = HostScanFixedTCPPort.COUNT (DISTINCT (destIpAddr))

rule.description: Detects excessive number of UDP connections from the same source to many distinct destinations in a short period of time. The threshold is 200 flows within 3 minutes. Scanning may be a precursor to exploits. However, network management and mapping tools often scan the network for discovery purposes and authorized scanners need to be blacklisted. P2P clients also exhibit this behavior when they attempt to establish connections to (non-existent) peers.

eventFilters.name: HostScanUDP
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "IOS-NETFLOW-BI" AND ipProto = 17 AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS)

rule.name: Heavy UDP Host Scan
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = HostScanUDP.srcIpAddr, incidentCount = HostScanUDP.COUNT (DISTINCT (destIpAddr))

rule.description: Detects excessive number of UDP connections from the same source to many distinct destinations and on the same destination port in a short period of time. The threshold is 200 flows within 3 minutes. A fixed destination port may indicate that the scanning host is attempting to find hosts on a well known port (with a vulnerability). Scanning may be a precursor to exploits. However, network management and mapping tools often scan the network for discovery purposes and authorized scanners need to be blacklisted. P2P clients also exhibit this behavior when they attempt to establish connections to (non-existent) peers.

eventFilters.name: HostScanFixedUDPPort
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "IOS-NETFLOW-BI" AND ipProto = 17 AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS)

rule.name: Heavy UDP Host Scan On Fixed Port
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = HostScanFixedUDPPort.srcIpAddr, destIpPort = HostScanFixedUDPPort.destIpPort, incidentCount = HostScanFixedUDPPort.COUNT (DISTINCT (destIpAddr))

rule.description: Detects excessive number of ICMP echo request packets from the same source to many distinct destinations in a short period of time. Nachi worm exploited pings to spread. The threshold is 50 pings within 3 minutes. Scanning may be a precursor to exploits. However, network management and mapping tools often scan the network for discovery purposes and authorized scanners need to be blacklisted.

eventFilters.name: PingSweep
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "IOS-NETFLOW-BI" AND ipProto = 1 AND icmpType = 8 AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS)

rule.name: Heavy ICMP Ping sweep
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = PingSweep.srcIpAddr, incidentCount = PingSweep.COUNT (DISTINCT (destIpAddr))

rule.description: Detects excessive number of half-open TCP connections from many distinct sources to the same destination host and on the same port in a short period of time. This may indicate that the destination server is under some sort of attack.
rule.name: TCP DDOS Attack
rule.incidentAttrs: destIpAddr = DDOS_TCP.destIpAddr, destIpPort = DDOS_TCP.destIpPort, incidentCount = DDOS_TCP.COUNT (DISTINCT (srcIpAddr))

rule.description: Detects excessive denies from the same source to many distinct destinations on the same port in a short period of time. The intent could be malicious or some sort of misconfiguration.
rule.name: Excessive Denied Connections From Same Src
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessDenySameSrc.srcIpAddr, destIpPort = ExcessDenySameSrc.destIpPort, incidentCount = ExcessDenySameSrc.COUNT (DISTINCT (destIpAddr))

rule.description: Detects excessive denies from many distinct sources to the same destination on the same destination port
rule.name: Excessive Denied Connections To Same Destination
rule.incidentAttrs: destIpAddr = ExcessDenySameDest.destIpAddr, destIpPort = ExcessDenySameDest.destIpPort, incidentCount = ExcessDenySameDest.COUNT (DISTINCT (srcIpAddr))

rule.description: Detects large (> 200 bytes/pkt) ICMP echo request and response packets - this is unusual since ICMP packets carry minimal information and are small in size. THis may indicate that some other traffic is being carried over ICMP protocol.
rule.name: Unusually Large ICMP Echo Packets
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = LargeICMPEchoReq.srcIpAddr, destIpAddr = LargeICMPEchoReq.destIpAddr

rule.description: Detects a scenario where a host, that is itself not an authorized mail gateway, is unsuccessfully trying to send excessive emails to unauthorized mail gateways. Authorized mail gateways are represented by the "Mail Gateway" group. Such requests would be typically denied because, either the firewall would block SMTP from end hosts and/or mail gateways only receive mail from other authorized mail gateways. This behavior may indicate malware running on an end host that is trying to send spam or privileged information to its own set of mail servers (which may be compromised).

eventFilters.name: EndUserMailToUnauthMailGw
eventFilters.singleConstraint: destIpPort = 25 AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW, Group@PH_SYS_APP_MAIL_SERVER) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW,Group@PH_SYS_APP_MAIL_SERVER) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

eventFilters.name: ExcessDeniedMail
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType IN (Group@PH_SYS_EVENT_DenyTraffic) AND destIpPort = 25 AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW,Group@PH_SYS_APP_MAIL_SERVER) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

eventFilters.name: ExcessPermitMail
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "IOS-NETFLOW-BI" AND srcDestTCPFlags = 2 AND ipProto = 6 AND destIpPort = 25 AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW,Group@PH_SYS_APP_MAIL_SERVER) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

rule.name: Excessive Denied End User Mail To Unauthorized Mail Gateways
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = EndUserMailToUnauthMailGw.srcIpAddr

rule.description: Detects a scenario where a host, that is itself not a DNS server, is trying to send DNS requests to unauthorized DNS servers. Authorized DNS servers are represented by the "DNS Server" group. In a typical scenario, end hosts always send DNS requests to authrozed DNS servers which in turn communicate to other DNS servers - so this behavior may indicate malware running on the end host.

eventFilters.name: UnauthDNS
eventFilters.singleConstraint: destIpPort = 53 AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_DNS_SERVER) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_DNS_SERVER,Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

rule.name: End User DNS Queries to Unauthorized DNS Servers
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = UnauthDNS.srcIpAddr, incidentCount = UnauthDNS.COUNT (DISTINCT (destIpAddr))

rule.description: Detects a scenario where a host, that is itself not an DNS server, is sending excessive DNS requests. Authorized DNS servers are represented by the "DNS Server" group. In a typical scenario, the frequency of end host DNS requests is not high unless, there is a script running - this might indicate the presence of malware on the end host.

eventFilters.name: ExcessiveDNSFromFlow
eventFilters.singleConstraint: destIpPort = 53 AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_DNS_SERVER) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_FIREWALL,Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_ROUTER_SWITCH) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

eventFilters.name: ExcessiveDNSFromServer
eventFilters.singleConstraint: srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_DNS_SERVER) AND reptDevIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_DNS_SERVER) AND (eventType CONTAIN "BIND_DNS" OR eventType CONTAIN "MS_DNS") AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

rule.name: Excessive End User DNS Queries
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessiveDNSFromFlow.srcIpAddr, srcIpAddr = ExcessiveDNSFromServer.srcIpAddr, incidentCount = ExcessiveDNSFromFlow.COUNT(*), incidentCount = ExcessiveDNSFromServer.COUNT(DISTINCT(destName))

rule.description: Detects a scenario where a host, has a very high frequency of denied DNS traffic.
rule.name: Excessive Denied DNS Queries
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = DeniedDNS.srcIpAddr, incidentCount = DeniedDNS.COUNT (*)

rule.description: Detects bad domain name queries which indicate malware infected end hosts.
rule.name: Excessive Malware Domain Name Queries
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = MalwareDNS.srcIpAddr, incidentCount = MalwareDNS.COUNT(DISTINCT (destName))

rule.description: Detects an end host meeting at least 3 requirements for suspicious use of DNS requests - this indicates that a bot is likely running on the end host
rule.name: Suspicious Botnet like End host DNS Behavior
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = BotnetSymptom.srcIpAddr

rule.description: Detects the same host that is not a DNS server, doing an excessive amount of uncommon domain name queries - this indicates the host is likely infected with malware. An end host typically needs to perform only A and PTR queries; any other query inidicates the likely presence of malware.

eventFilters.name: UncommonDNS
eventFilters.singleConstraint: srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_DNS_SERVER) AND eventType NOT IN ("BIND_DNS_A_Query", "BIND_DNS_PTR_Query", "MS_DNS_A_Query","MS_DNS_PTR_Query", "MS_DNS_A_Success", "MS_DNS_A_Fail", "MS_DNS_PTR_Success", "MS_DNS_PTR_Success", "MS_DNS_PTR_Fail") AND (eventType CONTAIN "BIND_DNS" OR eventType CONTAIN "MS_DNS")

rule.name: Excessive Uncommon DNS Queries
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = UncommonDNS.srcIpAddr, incidentCount =UncommonDNS.COUNT (*)

rule.description: Detects an usually high frequency of DNS name resolution queries from the same host to the same domain name in a short period of time. This is not expected behavior since, in a typical scenario, the domain name resolution is cached at the end point. Repeated queries indicates that a special DNS client is likely running at the end host that is trying to make use of fast flux techniques to get back many infected hosts behind a crafted domain name.
rule.name: Excessive Repeated DNS Queries To Same Domain
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = ExcessRepeatDNS.srcIpAddr, destName =ExcessRepeatDNS.destName, incidentCount = ExcessRepeatDNS.COUNT (*)

rule.description: Detects a scenario where a host, that is itself not an authorized mail gateway, is sending excessive emails (more than 20 emails in 2 minutes). This behavior may indicate malware running on an end host that is trying to send spam or privileged information to its own set of mail servers (which may be compromised).

eventFilters.name: EndUserExcessMail
eventFilters.singleConstraint: destIpPort = 25 AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_SEC_GW,Group@PH_SYS_APP_MAIL_SERVER) AND srcIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_NETWORK_ENTERPRISE_INTERNAL_NET)

rule.name: Excessive End User Mail
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = EndUserExcessMail.srcIpAddr,incidentCount = EndUserExcessMail.COUNT(*)

rule.description: Detects traffic anomaly from a source to a fixed port. This means that the traffic pattern from the source on the destination port is statistically anomalous in the following sense: (a) the number of flows from the source on the given port is more than twice the hourly average flow count, (b) total bytes exchanged by the source on the given port is more than twice the hourly average (c) more than 500 flows (with different 5 tuples) over a 10 minute window from the source on the port

eventFilters.name: StatHighFlowFromSrc
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "IOS-NETFLOW-BI" AND (ipProto = 17 OR ipProto = 6) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS)

rule.name: Traffic Anomaly From Host On Fixed Port
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = StatHighFlowFromSrc.srcIpAddr,destIpPort = StatHighFlowFromSrc.destIpPort,totFlows = StatHighFlowFromSrc.SUM(totFlows)

rule.description: Detects traffic anomaly to a destination on a fixed port. This means that the traffic pattern to the destination on the given port is statistically anomalous in the following sense: (a) the number of flows to the destination on the given port is more than twice the hourly average flow count, (b) total bytes exchanged by the destination on the given port is more than twice the hourly average (c) more than 500 flows (with different 5 tuples) over a 10 minute window to the destination on the port

eventFilters.name: StatHighFlowToDest
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "IOS-NETFLOW-BI" AND (ipProto = 17 OR ipProto = 6) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS)

rule.name: Traffic Anomaly To Host On Fixed Port
rule.incidentAttrs: destIpAddr = StatHighFlowToDest.destIpAddr,destIpPort = StatHighFlowToDest.destIpPort,totFlows = StatHighFlowToDest.SUM(totFlows)

rule.description: Detects traffic anomaly between a source and a destination on a fixed port. This means that the traffic pattern between the source and the destination on the given port is statistically anomalous in the following sense: (a) the number of flows between the source and the destination on the given port is more than twice the hourly average flow count, (b) total bytes exchanged between the source and the destination on the given port is more than twice the hourly average (c) more than 500 flows (with different 5 tuples) over a 10 minute window between the source and the destination on the port

eventFilters.name: StatHighFlowSrcDestPair
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "IOS-NETFLOW-BI" AND (ipProto = 17 OR ipProto = 6) AND srcIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS) AND destIpAddr NOT IN (Group@PH_SYS_APP_ACCELOPS)

rule.name: Traffic Anomaly Between Two Hosts On Fixed Port
rule.incidentAttrs: srcIpAddr = StatHighFlowSrcDestPair.srcIpAddr,destIpAddr = StatHighFlowSrcDestPair.destIpAddr,destIpPort = StatHighFlowSrcDestPair.destIpPort, totFlows = StatHighFlowSrcDestPair.SUM(totFlows)

rule.description: Detects that one or more of SMTP Server queues have crossed critical threshold

eventFilters.groupConstraint: COUNT (*) >= 2 AND (AVG(exchCatQueue) >= 10 OR AVG(exchSMTPLocalQueue) >= 1000 OR AVG(exchSMTPRemoteQueue) > 1000)
eventFilters.name: QueueHigh

rule.name: Exchange Server SMTP Queue high
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName = QueueHigh.hostName, exchCatQueue = QueueHigh.AVG(exchCatQueue), exchSMTPLocalQueue = QueueHigh.AVG(exchSMTPLocalQueue), exchSMTPRemoteQueue = QueueHigh.AVG(exchSMTPRemoteQueue)

rule.description: Detects that one or more of Exchange mailbox store queues have crossed critical threshold
rule.name: Exchange Server Mailbox Queue high
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName = QueueHigh.hostName, exchMboxName = QueueHigh.exchMboxName, exchMboxSendQueue = QueueHigh.AVG(exchMboxSendQueue), exchMboxRecvQueue = QueueHigh.AVG(exchMboxRecvQueue)

rule.description: Detects a spike in exchange server RPC requests
rule.name: Exchange Server RPC request high
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName = RPCHigh.hostName, exchRPCReq = RPCHigh.AVG(exchRPCReq)

rule.description: Detects excessive exchange server RPC request latency
rule.name: Exchange Server RPC latency high
rule.incidentAttrs: hostName = RPCLatencyHigh.hostName, exchRPCAvgLatency = RPCLatencyHigh.AVG(exchRPCAvgLatency)

rule.description: Detects that server disk I/O latency has reached a warning level (between 20 and 50 msec) based on 2 successive readings in a 10 minute interval

eventFilters.groupConstraint: (( AVG ( devDiskRdLatency )>= 20 AND AVG ( devDiskRdLatency )< 50 ) OR( AVG ( devDiskWrLatency )>= 20 AND AVG ( devDiskWrLatency )< 50 )) AND COUNT ( * )>= 2
eventFilters.name: ServDiskLatencyWarn
eventFilters.singleConstraint: eventType = "PH_DEV_MON_DISK_IO_UTIL" AND hostIpAddr IN (Group@PH_SYS_DEVICE_Server) AND diskName NOT IN ("/boot")
